activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Lee Clay III

3:38 PM Defendant Robert Lee Clay III appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Robert Lee Clay III.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $250 Signature Bond with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim J.L., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:00 AM.
